hero.title: Legal Insights & Updates
hero.subtitle: Stay informed with our expert analysis and industry updates for technology companies

dsa2024.title: EU Digital Services Act 2024: What Technology Companies Need to Know
dsa2024.excerpt: A comprehensive guide to the new Digital Services Act and its implications for tech companies operating in the EU.
dsa2024.content:
The European Union's Digital Services Act (DSA) represents one of the most significant regulatory developments for technology companies in recent years. This landmark legislation introduces comprehensive obligations for digital service providers, fundamentally changing how technology companies must operate within the European Union.

The DSA applies to a broad range of digital services, including online platforms, search engines, and other intermediary services. Companies falling under its scope must implement robust content moderation systems, enhance transparency in their algorithmic processes, and establish clear procedures for handling user complaints and appeals.

For technology companies, compliance with the DSA requires significant operational and technical adjustments. This includes implementing new risk assessment procedures, establishing dedicated compliance teams, and potentially restructuring certain business processes to align with the regulatory requirements.

The implications extend beyond mere compliance costs. Companies must also consider the strategic impact on their business models, particularly those relying heavily on algorithmic content distribution or user-generated content. The DSA's transparency requirements may necessitate fundamental changes to how companies present their services to users.

Our legal team has extensive experience helping technology companies navigate complex regulatory landscapes. We provide comprehensive DSA compliance assessments and implementation strategies tailored to each client's specific business model and operational requirements.

taxOptimization.title: Tax Optimization Strategies for International Technology Companies
taxOptimization.excerpt: Explore effective tax planning strategies for technology companies with global operations.
taxOptimization.content:
International technology companies face unique tax challenges due to the global nature of their operations and the intangible nature of many digital services. Effective tax planning requires a comprehensive understanding of multiple jurisdictions and their respective tax regimes.

One of the primary considerations for technology companies is the allocation of intellectual property rights and licensing revenues across different jurisdictions. Strategic placement of IP assets can significantly impact overall tax efficiency while ensuring compliance with anti-avoidance regulations such as the OECD's Base Erosion and Profit Shifting (BEPS) initiatives.

The concept of permanent establishment has evolved significantly with digital businesses. Technology companies must carefully evaluate their activities in each jurisdiction to determine their tax obligations and potential exposure to corporate income tax.

Transfer pricing policies play a crucial role in international tax planning for technology companies. Proper documentation and economic justification of inter-company transactions are essential to avoid disputes with tax authorities and ensure compliance with local regulations.

Our tax advisory team works closely with technology companies to develop comprehensive tax strategies that balance efficiency with compliance requirements. We provide ongoing support to ensure that tax structures remain effective as businesses evolve and regulatory landscapes change.

corporateStructuring.title: Corporate Structuring Best Practices for Startups
corporateStructuring.excerpt: Essential considerations for startups when establishing their corporate structure and legal framework.
corporateStructuring.content:
The corporate structure of a startup forms the foundation for its future growth and success. Making the right decisions early can significantly impact a company's ability to raise funding, expand internationally, and achieve strategic objectives.

One of the first considerations is the choice of incorporation jurisdiction. While many startups default to incorporating in their home country, international businesses often benefit from more strategic jurisdictional choices that consider factors such as tax efficiency, regulatory environment, and access to international markets.

Equity structure and governance arrangements are critical components that require careful planning. Startups must balance the need for flexibility with investor protection requirements, particularly when preparing for future funding rounds. This includes implementing appropriate share classes, vesting schedules, and decision-making mechanisms.

Intellectual property protection should be integrated into the corporate structure from the outset. This involves not only securing appropriate IP rights but also ensuring that these assets are held in the optimal jurisdictions and corporate entities within the group structure.

Regulatory compliance considerations vary significantly depending on the nature of the business and the markets it serves. Technology startups, in particular, must navigate complex data protection, financial services, and industry-specific regulations that may impact their corporate structure choices.

Our team specializes in helping startups establish robust corporate structures that support their growth objectives while maintaining flexibility for future changes and opportunities.

aiCompliance.title: AI Legal Framework: Navigating the Regulatory Landscape
aiCompliance.excerpt: Understanding the evolving legal requirements for artificial intelligence and machine learning companies.
aiCompliance.content:
The artificial intelligence sector is experiencing unprecedented growth, accompanied by rapidly evolving regulatory frameworks that companies must navigate carefully to ensure compliance and maintain competitive advantage.

The European Union's proposed AI Act represents the most comprehensive attempt to regulate artificial intelligence systems globally. This legislation introduces a risk-based approach to AI regulation, categorizing AI systems based on their potential impact and imposing varying levels of compliance requirements.

High-risk AI systems, including those used in critical infrastructure, education, and law enforcement, face the most stringent requirements. Companies developing such systems must implement robust quality management systems, ensure human oversight, and maintain detailed documentation of their AI models and training data.

Data protection considerations are particularly complex for AI companies, as they often involve processing large volumes of personal data for training and operational purposes. Compliance with GDPR and similar regulations requires careful attention to legal bases for processing, data minimization principles, and individual rights.

Intellectual property strategies for AI companies must address unique challenges related to AI-generated content, training data ownership, and patent protection for AI innovations. The intersection of AI and IP law continues to evolve, requiring specialized expertise to navigate effectively.

Our legal team provides comprehensive support to AI companies, helping them establish compliant business practices while preserving their ability to innovate and compete in rapidly evolving markets.

gdprUpdate.title: GDPR Updates 2024: New Enforcement Trends
gdprUpdate.excerpt: Latest developments in GDPR enforcement and what companies need to know about compliance.
gdprUpdate.content:
The General Data Protection Regulation continues to evolve through enforcement actions and regulatory guidance, creating new compliance considerations for technology companies operating in the European Union.

Recent enforcement trends show increased focus on algorithmic decision-making and automated processing systems. Data protection authorities are paying particular attention to companies' ability to explain their algorithmic processes and ensure meaningful human involvement in significant decisions affecting individuals.

The concept of legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing has been refined through recent decisions and guidance. Companies must conduct more rigorous legitimate interest assessments and demonstrate that their business interests do not override individuals' privacy rights.

International data transfers remain a complex area, with ongoing developments in adequacy decisions and the evolution of transfer mechanisms such as Standard Contractual Clauses and Binding Corporate Rules.

Our GDPR compliance team helps companies stay current with regulatory developments and implement effective privacy programs that support business objectives while ensuring full compliance with data protection requirements.

fintech.title: FinTech Regulatory Landscape: 2024 Outlook
fintech.excerpt: Comprehensive overview of the regulatory environment for financial technology companies.
fintech.content:
The financial technology sector continues to experience significant regulatory evolution as authorities worldwide adapt their frameworks to address the unique characteristics and risks of digital financial services.

Open banking regulations are expanding globally, creating new opportunities and compliance obligations for FinTech companies. Understanding these requirements and their implications for data sharing, customer consent, and competitive positioning is crucial for companies operating in this space.

Cryptocurrency and digital asset regulations are becoming increasingly sophisticated, with many jurisdictions implementing comprehensive frameworks that address everything from custody requirements to market conduct obligations.

Our FinTech legal team provides specialized guidance to help companies navigate these complex regulatory environments while building sustainable and compliant business models.

crossBorder.title: Cross-Border Tax Planning in the Digital Age
crossBorder.excerpt: Modern approaches to international tax planning for digital businesses.
crossBorder.content:
Digital businesses face unique challenges in international tax planning due to the borderless nature of their operations and the ongoing evolution of international tax rules.

The OECD's Pillar One and Pillar Two initiatives represent fundamental changes to international tax principles, particularly affecting large multinational technology companies. Understanding these changes and their implementation timelines is crucial for effective tax planning.

Digital services taxes implemented by various countries create additional complexity for technology companies, requiring careful analysis of triggering thresholds and compliance obligations.

Our international tax team helps companies develop comprehensive strategies that address these evolving requirements while optimizing overall tax efficiency.

saasLegal.title: SaaS Legal Considerations: Contracts and Compliance
saasLegal.excerpt: Key legal issues for Software-as-a-Service companies in contract structuring and regulatory compliance.
saasLegal.content:
Software-as-a-Service companies face unique legal challenges related to contract structuring, data protection, and regulatory compliance across multiple jurisdictions.

Customer agreements must balance flexibility with legal protection, addressing issues such as service level commitments, data processing obligations, and limitation of liability provisions.

Regulatory compliance varies significantly depending on the industries served and the types of data processed. SaaS companies serving regulated industries must implement appropriate controls and oversight mechanisms.

Our team helps SaaS companies develop comprehensive legal frameworks that support their business models while ensuring full compliance with applicable regulations.

fintech.title: FinTech Startup Global Structure
fintech.overview: A comprehensive corporate structuring project for a financial technology startup expanding globally, requiring compliance with multiple regulatory frameworks.
fintech.challenge: The client needed to establish a corporate structure that would accommodate rapid international expansion while ensuring compliance with financial services regulations in multiple jurisdictions.
fintech.solution: We designed a multi-jurisdictional structure with holding companies in optimal locations, subsidiary operations in target markets, and a comprehensive compliance framework.
fintech.results: Successfully launched operations in 5 jurisdictions within 12 months, securing necessary licenses and regulatory approvals while maintaining tax efficiency.

ecommerce.title: E-commerce Platform European Expansion
ecommerce.overview: Legal framework development for an e-commerce platform entering new European markets with complex regulatory requirements.
ecommerce.challenge: The platform needed to comply with varying consumer protection laws, data protection requirements, and tax obligations across multiple EU member states.
ecommerce.solution: We established a centralized European structure with local compliance mechanisms and a comprehensive legal framework covering all operational aspects.
ecommerce.results: Successful market entry in 8 EU countries with full regulatory compliance and optimized tax structure.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: For questions regarding these terms, please contact us at:

overview.title: What Are Cookies
overview.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit our website. They help us provide you with a better user experience.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled.

performance.title: Performance Cookies
performance.content: These cookies help us understand how visitors use our website by collecting anonymous information.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.content: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as language preferences.

targeting.title: Targeting Cookies
targeting.content: These cookies may be set by our advertising partners to build a profile of your interests.

control.title: Managing Cookies
control.content: You can control and manage cookies through your browser settings. Please note that disabling certain cookies may affect the functionality of our website.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.content: We may also use third-party services that place cookies on your device. These are governed by the respective third parties' privacy policies.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about our use of cookies, please contact us at:

page.title: CORPORATE & TAX STRUCTURING SERVICES
page.description: We help technology companies and start-ups establish optimal business structure and framework. We design and realise efficient company structure and special statuses, that align with your business objectives whilst ensuring compliance dependent from the type of commercial activity. We provide strategic guidance that supports your expansion plans and minimises regulatory risks.

corporateStructuring.title: Corporate and tax structuring (jurisdiction selection)
corporateStructuring.description: We analyse your business model, revenue streams, and operational requirements to recommend the most suitable jurisdictions for your corporate structure. Our assessment considers factors including tax efficiency, regulatory environment, international treaties, and practical business considerations to create corporate structures that aligns your key commercial objectives.

incorporation.title: Company incorporation (30+ jurisdictions)
incorporation.description: We facilitate company registration across more than 30 jurisdictions, including popular technology hubs in the EU, UK, USA, CIS, and other key markets.

locations.eu: European Union: Poland, Estonia, Netherlands, Cyprus, Ireland, Malta

bankAccount.title: Bank account opening
bankAccount.description: We assist with opening corporate bank accounts in your chosen jurisdictions.

governance.title: Corporate governance documents. Share Purchase Agreements, Shareholders Agreements
governance.description: We design legal framework for your business relations with partners, investors, management and other stakeholders. We draft and negotiate investment documentation including share purchase agreements, shareholders' agreements, and related corporate governance documents. We ensure these agreements address sector-specific issues such as intellectual property rights, employee share schemes, and exit provisions.

investment.title: SAFE and investment agreements
investment.description: We guide companies on formalising investment attraction activities. We prepare Simple Agreements for Future Equity (SAFE) and other investment instruments commonly used in start-up funding rounds.

specialPrograms.title: Special programmes and zones for IT companies and start-ups (IT-Park, Virtual zone)
specialPrograms.description: We guide companies through applications for special economic zones, IT parks, and government incentive programmes designed for technology businesses. These programmes often provide significant tax advantages, simplified regulatory procedures, and other benefits.

hero.title: LEGAL SUPPORT FOR IT COMPANIES
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive legal support for technology companies at all development stages—from startup to international scaling

b2bContracts.title: B2B Contracts
b2bContracts.description: We draft and negotiate commercial agreements under English law and other jurisdictions, covering the full spectrum of technology business relationships. Our experience spans software development agreements, SaaS contracts, master service agreements, agency and distribution arrangements, and outsourcing documentation.

investmentAgreements.title: Investment-related agreements
investmentAgreements.description: For companies raising capital or structuring ownership, we prepare shareholders agreements, share purchase agreements, SAFE and KISS instruments, investment documentation, and convertible loan agreements. We also handle protective documentation including NDAs, non-compete agreements, and IP assignment contracts.

gamedevSupport.title: Gamedev Support
gamedevSupport.description:
Game developers require specialised legal support that understands platform ecosystems and industry dynamics. We ensure compliance with Apple App Store, Google Play Market, and Steam policies, including age rating requirements. Our publishing documentation covers game publishing agreements, co-development arrangements, and royalty structures.

We prepare user-facing documents tailored to gaming contexts—EULAs, terms of use, privacy policies, and in-game purchase policies. When copycats threaten your game, we enforce your rights through DMCA takedown notices, DSA complaints, and trademark enforcement across digital platforms.

privacyDataProtection.title: Privacy & Data Protection
privacyDataProtection.description:
GDPR compliance requires structured internal processes and proper documentation. We conduct data protection impact assessments, develop privacy policies and cookie policies, structure internal data processing procedures, and provide guidance on lawful processing requirements. We also prepare data processing agreements for your vendor relationships.

For AI-powered products, we support AI Act compliance through risk assessments, documentation requirements, and regulatory filings for high-risk systems. We also address jurisdiction-specific requirements including COPPA for children's applications and California privacy law.

We speak the language of products and understand tech stacks, so our documents protect your interests without creating operational barriers for development teams.

hero.title: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive IP asset protection for technology companies at all development stages.

ipDueDiligence.title: IP Due Diligence & Clearance
ipDueDiligence.description: We conduct intellectual property due diligence reviews for investments and acquisitions, and provide IP clearance opinions to assess potential infringement risks before product launches. Our analysis identifies IP risks at the development stage and verifies ownership and chain of title for IP assets, ensuring clean IP foundations for your business.

ipRightsRegistration.title: IP Rights Registration
ipRightsRegistration.description: We handle trademark applications and registrations across key jurisdictions including the European Union, United Kingdom, United States, Georgia, Armenia, and others. For international protection, we coordinate Madrid Protocol applications that streamline multi-jurisdiction coverage. We also manage copyright registrations and advise on comprehensive copyright protection strategies.

ipAgreements.title: IP Agreements
ipAgreements.description: We prepare the full spectrum of IP documentation for technology companies: assignment agreements for transferring IP ownership, license agreements covering exclusive, non-exclusive, and sublicensing arrangements, and user-facing documents like EULAs and terms of use for software and platforms. We also structure co-development IP arrangements and work-for-hire agreements to ensure proper rights allocation from the outset.

domainDisputes.title: Domain Disputes
domainDisputes.description: We represent clients in domain name disputes under UDRP and URS proceedings, recovering domain names from cybersquatters and resolving trademark conflicts. We also coordinate court-based domain disputes when administrative procedures are insufficient.

copycatCombating.title: Copycat combating
copycatCombating.description: When infringement occurs on digital platforms, we take action through DMCA takedown notices, DSA complaints for EU jurisdictions, and direct enforcement with platform holders. We have extensive experience blocking copycat applications on App Store, Google Play, and Steam, as well as removing infringing content across digital marketplaces.

aiIpStrategy.title: AI & IP Strategy
aiIpStrategy.description: For AI-powered products, we advise on IP ownership of AI-generated content, develop policies for using AI tools in your business, structure IP strategy for AI products, and negotiate training data licensing arrangements.

content.conclusion: We don't merely register rights—we build proactive enforcement strategies that prevent infringements and ensure rapid responses when they occur. Over the past three years, we have blocked 100+ copycat applications and domains for our clients.

hero.title: PRIVATE & DELICATE MATTERS
hero.subtitle: Confidential legal support for founders and business owners on matters requiring particular discretion.

migrationTaxPlanning.title: Migration & Tax Planning
migrationTaxPlanning.description:
We coordinate residence permit applications and citizenship programmes across multiple jurisdictions. In the European Union, we support applications in Poland, Hungary (including the accelerated National Card programme with a 3-year path to permanent residence), France (Visiteur status with remote renewal), Portugal, Spain, Slovakia, and Switzerland.

Our experience extends to citizenship acquisition in Georgia (including accelerated naturalisation), Armenia, Vanuatu, Turkey, and EU naturalisation strategies through residence pathways.

Personal tax planning is integrated throughout the migration process. We advise on tax residency optimisation, develop tax-efficient relocation strategies, address cross-border personal taxation issues, and coordinate with your corporate structuring to ensure alignment between personal and business tax planning.

personalAssetManagement.title: Personal Asset Management
personalAssetManagement.description:
For high-net-worth technology entrepreneurs, we provide guidance on international asset structuring, tax-efficient wealth management solutions, and cross-border financial planning.

Where applicable, we advise on trust structures and estate planning for international assets. This work is closely coordinated with your corporate structure to ensure alignment of personal and corporate tax planning, exit strategy considerations, and dividend policy optimisation.

reputationProtection.title: Reputation Protection
reputationProtection.description:
We address online reputation issues including removal of defamatory content from social media, Google search results management, and right to be forgotten requests under GDPR.

For clients affected by World-Check listings, we handle correction of inaccuracies, remediation procedures for false matches, and preparation of supporting documentation. Where necessary, we coordinate crisis communication and support defamation proceedings.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: All matters in this section are handled with maximum discretion. Communication occurs via encrypted channels, documents are stored with enhanced security measures, and third parties are engaged only with explicit client approval.

hero.title: DISPUTE RESOLUTION
hero.subtitle: We represent technology company interests in cross-border commercial disputes, focusing on IT-specific conflicts.

internationalCommercialArbitration.title: International Commercial Arbitration
internationalCommercialArbitration.description:
We have extensive experience representing clients in leading arbitral institutions including ICC, SCC, HKIAC, SIAC, CIETAC, VIAC, LCIA, and ICAC, with additional experience in ICSID arbitration and PCA proceedings.

Track Record: 20+ successful arbitration cases in the EU, CIS, and Asia

typesOfDisputes.title: Types of Disputes
typesOfDisputes.description: Our arbitration practice focuses on technology sector disputes: software development conflicts involving scope changes, delays, quality acceptance, and IP ownership; investment disputes including SAFE/KISS conversions, shareholder conflicts, and valuation issues; game publishing disputes over royalties, marketing obligations, and territory restrictions; and commercial contract disputes covering supply agreements, licensing, and distribution arrangements.

litigationInForeignCourts.title: Litigation in Foreign Courts
litigationInForeignCourts.description: We coordinate litigation strategies in foreign jurisdictions, working with local counsel to represent client interests in commercial disputes across multiple legal systems. We also prepare expert legal opinions on Belarusian, Georgian, and Russian law for foreign court proceedings.

debtRecovery.title: Debt Recovery
debtRecovery.description: We provide comprehensive debt recovery services across the EU, Georgia, and CIS countries through pre-litigation negotiations, arbitration-based recovery, court proceedings coordination, and cross-border enforcement strategies.

ourApproach.title: Our Approach
ourApproach.description:
We view arbitration and litigation as a last resort. Priority is given to early-stage dispute settlement through negotiations. However, if conflict resolution proves impossible, we pursue the case to a successful outcome with full commitment to client interests.

EUR 13 million — total debt recovered for clients in 2024

turnkeyBusiness.title: Turnkey business and taxes
turnkeyBusiness.description: Comprehensive business setup and tax optimization solutions for technology companies and startups. We handle all aspects of business formation, from initial incorporation to ongoing tax planning, ensuring your business structure is efficient and compliant across multiple jurisdictions.

licensingRegulations.title: Licensing and regulations
licensingRegulations.description: Navigate complex regulatory environments with our expertise in securing necessary licenses and ensuring ongoing compliance. We help technology companies understand and meet regulatory requirements across different sectors and jurisdictions, minimizing risk and enabling smooth operations.

itSupport.title: IT companies support
itSupport.description: Specialized legal support tailored for technology companies, including software licensing, data protection compliance, intellectual property strategies, and digital services regulations. Our team understands the unique challenges facing IT businesses in today's evolving regulatory landscape.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual property
intellectualProperty.description: Comprehensive intellectual property protection and commercialization strategies. We help secure patents, trademarks, and copyrights, develop licensing agreements, and create IP portfolios that support your business objectives and protect your innovations in global markets.

disputesArbitration.title: Disputes and arbitration
disputesArbitration.description: Expert dispute resolution services including commercial litigation, international arbitration, and alternative dispute resolution. Our experienced team represents clients in complex commercial disputes, contractual disagreements, and cross-border conflicts with a focus on achieving practical business solutions.

confidentialityMigration.title: Private & Delicate Matters
confidentialityMigration.description: Secure business migration and confidentiality services for companies relocating operations or expanding internationally. We ensure smooth transitions while maintaining strict confidentiality standards and protecting sensitive business information throughout the process.
